intro: Feea humboldtii, commonly known as the Humboldt's feea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
